publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6941 Jackie Baillie: New Era At Bonhill School—That the Parliament congratulates Bonhill Primary School on the opening of its brand new school building; notes that the £5 million facility was planned and agreed by the former Labour-controlled West Dunbartonshire Council; understands that the new facility includes interactive whiteboards, a state-of-the-art multipurpose football pitch and an IT suite that provides every pupil with a netbook computer, and wishes all the pupils and the staff the greatest of success in an educational establishment that is fit for 21st century learning.

S3M-6941 Jackie Baillie: New Era At Bonhill School—That the Parliament congratulates Bonhill Primary School on the opening of its brand new school building; notes that the £5 million facility was planned and agreed by the former Labour-controlled West Dunbartonshire Council; understands that the new facility includes interactive whiteboards, a state-of-the-art multipurpose football pitch and an IT suite that provides every pupil with a netbook computer, and wishes all the pupils and the staff the greatest of success in an educational establishment that is fit for 21st century learning.
S3M-6941 New Era At Bonhill School (lodged on 8 September 2010) James Kelly*, Des McNulty*
S3M-6941 New Era At Bonhill School (lodged on 8 September 2010) Pauline McNeill*, Margaret Curran*, Karen Whitefield*
S3M-6941 New Era At Bonhill School (lodged on 8 September 2010) Hugh Henry*, David Stewart*
S3M-6941 New Era At Bonhill School (lodged on 8 September 2010) Mary Mulligan*
S3M-6941 New Era At Bonhill School (lodged on 8 September 2010) Ken Macintosh*
